body.p:
Woodburn Ky Nov 30th 1865
Maj. Genl John. M. Palmer

Genl I have the honor to request that Paterick Rynn Private Co. H. 11th Ky Vol. Cav U. S. A. Now an inmate of the Kentucky State Prison. be released from the following Reasons Said Soldier was charged with Shooting and Slightly Wounding One W. L. Poynter a Notorious Rebel of Barren County Ky

Who had Some Two months previous in connection with three (3) other men Run Said Soldier Some five miles Shooting at him Several times: Said Paterick Ryinn was a true and faithful Soldier brave & ever at his Post he was tried by a Jury of Rebel Symithisers & Consequently Condemned I could get every officer in the 11th Ky Cav to Sign a Petion for his release if necessary if you cannot release him any information
that you can give in Regard to the propoer mode to pursue will be very Thankfully Recd by one that has been for years in the Service of his Country

I Am Genl very Respectfully Your Obedient Servant
A R Smith Ex Lieut
Co D 12 Ky Cav
formerly
Cmd Sargt Co H
11th Ky vol Cav

Woodburn. Ky November 30/65.
S. 658. Vol. 2. D. K. 1865
Smith, A. R.
Ex=Lieut Co "D" 12th
KY Cy.

Prays that Patrick Rynn, Pvt Co "H" 11th Ky. Cy tried before a jury of Rebel sympathizers and found guilty of shooting one W. S. Poynter, a notorious Rebel be released from confinement -- Says that Rynn has been a good & faithful soldier, which will be testified, if necessary, by his former Officers --

Head Qrs. Dept of Kentucky
Louisville. Dec. 21. 1865.
L R
Respectfully referred to Thos. E. Bramlette Gov of Ky.

John M Palmer
Maj. Gen. Comd'g.
